case_name: Appellant public limited company v. Income-tax Officer

facts.text: The appellant is a public limited company carrying on the business of manufacturing and selling cloth and other textile goods.

anchor.surface_text: The appellant is a public limited companypany carrying on the business manufacturing and selling cloth and other textile goods.

facts.text: During the previous year ending on 31st December 1948 corresponding to assessment year 1949-50, the appellant entered into two contracts with two other parties for purchase of textile machinery to expand its factory.

anchor.surface_text: During the previous year ending on 31st December, 1948, companyresponding to the assessment year 1949-50, the appellant entered into two companytracts with two other parties for purchase of textile machinery in order to expand its factory.

facts.text: The appellant-company decided to cancel both the contracts due to altered circumstances as the machinery would not be required for its business.

anchor.surface_text: Subsequently, the appellant-company, having regard to altered circumstances, decided to cancel both the companytracts as, in its opinion, the machinery to be purchased would number be required for its business.

facts.text: On cancellation of the contracts, the appellant paid Rs. 15,000 as compensation to one contracting party and Rs. 20,000 to the other contracting party for breach of contract.

anchor.surface_text: On cancellation of these companytracts, the appellant had to pay a sum of Rs. 15,000 as companypensation to one of the companytracting parties and Rs. 20,000 to the other companytracting party who demanded companypensation for breach of companytract.

facts.text: The total compensation paid was Rs. 35,000.

anchor.surface_text: the payment of companypensation amounting to Rs. 35,000 has been rightly disallowed

facts.text: The appellant claimed deduction of Rs. 35,000 under section 10(2)(xv) of the Income-tax Act as expenditure incurred wholly and exclusively for the purpose of its business.

anchor.surface_text: The appellant claimed that these amounts were paid in the interest of its business as, otherwise, the appellant would have had to track very companytly machinery which would number have served any useful purpose, so that this was an expenditure incurred by the companypany wholly and exclusively for the purpose of its business.

facts.text: The Income-tax Officer disallowed the deduction claimed under section 10(2)(xv).

anchor.surface_text: The deduction thus claimed under section 10 2  xv  of the Income-tax Act was, however, disallowed by the Income-tax Officer,

facts.text: The order of the Income-tax Officer was upheld by the Appellate Assistant Commissioner and the Income-tax Appellate Tribunal.

anchor.surface_text: and that order was upheld by the Appellate Assistant Commissioner and the Income-tax Appellate Tribunal.

facts.text: On application under section 66(1) of the Income-tax Act, the Tribunal referred a question to the High Court at Allahabad.

anchor.surface_text: Thereupon, on an application under section 66 1  of the Income-tax Act, the Tribunal referred the following question for the opinion of the High Court at Allahabad

facts.text: The question referred was: Whether, on the facts of the case, the payment of compensation amounting to Rs. 35,000 has been rightly disallowed as capital expenditure within the meaning of section 10(2)(xv) of the Income-tax Act, 1922?

anchor.surface_text: Whether, on the facts of the case, the payment of companypensation amounting to Rs. 35,000 has been rightly disallowed as capital expenditure within the meaning of section 10 2  xv  of the Income-tax Act, 1922 ?

facts.text: The High Court answered the question against the appellant and upheld the order of the Tribunal.

anchor.surface_text: The High Court answered the question against the appellant and upheld the order of the Tribunal.

facts.text: The appellant came up to this court in appeal by special leave.

anchor.surface_text: Consequently, the appellant has companye up to this companyrt in this appeal by special leave.

facts.text: The facts put forward by the appellant were accepted by the Tribunal and the High Court.

anchor.surface_text: On the facts put forward by the appellant itself and accepted by the Tribunal and the High Court,

facts.text: The sum of Rs. 35,000 was paid for breach of contracts in respect of purchase of textile machinery which would have been a capital asset.

anchor.surface_text: it is clear that the sum of Rs. 35,000 claimed as deduction under section 10 2  xv  was really paid for breach of companytracts in respect of purchase of textile machinery which would have been a capital asset.

facts.text: The payment was made to avoid a larger capital expenditure that would not have served the interests of the appellant-company.

anchor.surface_text: The payment was, therefore made to avoid a larger capital expenditure that would number have served the interests of the appellant-company.

facts.text: The payment is in the nature of capital expenditure.

anchor.surface_text: Such a payment made is clearly in the nature of a capital expenditure and number an expenditure incurred wholly or exclusively for the purpose of the business.

facts.text: The deduction of Rs. 35,000 could not have been claimed as a legitimate deduction under section 10(2)(xv) of the Income-tax Act.

anchor.surface_text: It is, therefore, clear that this amount companyld number have been claimed has a legitimate deduction under section 10 2  xv  of the Income-tax Act.

facts.text: The appellant would have had to procure very costly machinery which would not have served any useful purpose otherwise.

anchor.surface_text: The payment was neither made for the purpose of earning profits, number for the purpose of furthering, protecting or companytinuing its business which was to be carried on from day to day. The payment was made with the object of avoiding an unnecessary investment in capital assets, and was an amount which was altogether outside the account of profits and gains, in the companyputation of which deductions are allowable for expenditure incurred wholly and exclusive for earning those profits and gains.
